intro: Calampelis scabra, commonly known as the rough calampelis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, usually yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
